definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: Then the nail must be straightened before it can be hammered into place correctly.
sentences.chinese: 於是在把釘子正確地釘入之前，需要先弄直它。

sentences.english: Even though his sons tried, they couldn't straighten them out.
sentences.chinese: 不管他的兒子們怎麼用力，照舊不能把它們弄直。

sentences.english: Straighten out the material before cutting it.
sentences.chinese: 在切割前先將材料弄直。

sentences.english: He bent a crooked circle straight.
He straightened a piece of wire.
Get a paperclip or safety pin and bend it straight.
sentences.chinese: 拿一個回形針或安全別針然後將它弄直。
他把那彎曲的金屬片弄直了。

sentences.english: She never got her hair conked.
sentences.chinese: 她從來就沒有把頭髮弄直過。

sentences.english: This kind of wire is easy to unbend.
sentences.chinese: 這種金屬線很容易弄直。

sentences.english: I have natural curl. I would like to straighten my hair.
sentences.chinese: 我角自然捲，我想要把我的頭髮弄直。

sentences.english: After much tugging, the rope untangled itself and straightened out.
sentences.chinese: 拉了好久才把纜繩解開弄直。

sentences.english: Exercise helped to straighten the injured arm .
sentences.chinese: 體操有助於弄直受傷的手臂。

sentences.english: Striving to do so will straighten your spine.
sentences.chinese: 努力的做下去可以弄直你的脊柱。

sentences.english: Straighten out the sword found in the underground passage.
sentences.chinese: 把地下通道里找到的劍弄直。

definition: see 直髮器|直发器[zhi2 fa4 qi4]
to condition or dye the hair using hair treatment product in conjunction with a hair steamer
scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate
to straighten/(slang) to turn a gay person straight
